com.camerontec.catalys.server.ha.communications

Interface IChannelListener

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DistributedCollectionRegistry, DistributedGroup, OperationMarshaller

    public interface IChannelListener
    Message listener callback interface.

    This is the only method of receiving messages and is called regardless of whether the message is received via multicast or unicast.

    Only messages on the specified topic, which is bound during channel creation, are received on this channel.

    The message receiver may assume that message delivery is single threaded, BUT it must not block or perform potentially long running operations during message processing.

    In order to process the message the listener must:

    • Use the field to determine the message type
    • Create or otherwise obtain an instance of the appropriate message type (which is assumed to implement ExternalizableData)
    • Wrap the ChannelMessage.rxData in a BytesSegmentBuffer via BytesSegmentBuffer.wrap(com.camerontec.util.data.BytesSegment)
    • Deserialize using ExternalizableData.deserialize(com.camerontec.util.data.Buffer, int, int) (where the offset and length parameters are obtainable from the\ ChannelMessage.rxData field.
    See Also:
    IChannelFactory

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onMessage(ChannelMessage message)
      On receipt of a channel message.

    • Method Detail

      • onMessage

        void onMessage(ChannelMessage message)
        throws IOException,
               InterruptedException
        On receipt of a channel message.
        Parameters:
        message - The message.
        Throws:
        IOException - On error processing message.
        InterruptedException - On being interrupted while processing message.
